channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Affordable Housing Crisis is About More Than Interest Rates. It Started Decades Ago With NIMBYism.
item.description: NIMBYs, YIMBYs, and the struggle that's resulted in a housing crisis unlike we've ever seen. The real story of today's housing market goes back several decades.

item.title: Warren Buffet’s Berkshire Hathaway sells half its Apple stock
item.description: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway cut its Apple holding by around half, to $84.2 billion, according to an SEC filing. While Apple remains the firm’s largest stock holding by far, Buffett had already reduced its stake by 13 percent earlier this year, hinting that he didn’t mind selling “a little Apple” for tax reasons. Berkshire Hathaway […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.

item.title: Senator Warren’s New Bill Includes Estate Tax Hikes, Private Equity Crackdowns, and Incentives
item.description: The American Housing and Mobility Act would use estate tax increases to incentivize development. Private equity, lenders, and homeowners are caught in the crossfire.

item.title: Zuckerberg and Jensen show off their friendship, while an AI necklace covets yours
item.description: A fireside chat between Jensen Huang and Mark Zuckerberg at SIGGRAPH 2024 took some unexpected turns. What started as a conversation about the capabilities of Nvidia GPUs and Zuckerberg’s vision of an AI chatbot future quickly became a more casual affair — including a swap of custom-made jackets, a rare F-bomb from the Meta CEO, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Facing Rollbacks, Criminal Justice Reformers Argue Policies Make People Safer
item.description: Advocates are refining their rebuttal to “tough on crime” messaging: Don’t focus on punishment, but on reforms that improve public safety.

item.title: Maximizing Your Rental Income: Four Tips From My House-Hacking Experience
item.description: Follow this advice to get your REI journey off on the right foot.

item.title: When a big company comes after a hot startup, it’s not a slam dunk decision to sell
item.description: We spoke to Harness CEO and founder Jyoti Bansal about his previous company, which Cisco bought for $3.7 billion in 2017. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: Rookie Reply: Rent-Raising Renovations, the 1% Rule, & Quitting Real Estate
item.description: Real estate investing offers a roadmap to financial freedom, but it’s far from easy. If you’re feeling the stress of ownership, whether it’s due to a difficult tenant or unforeseen […]

item.title: Trade My Spin is building a business around used Peloton equipment
item.description: Trade My Spin has pieced together a logistics network capable of offering same or next day delivery in most major cities in the continental U.S. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.

item.title: BiggerNews: The Market Bets on Mortgage Rates Falling, More Homes for Sale
item.description: Mortgage rates are set to fall this year and well into 2025, all while housing inventory steadily increases. We’re in the best housing inventory position since before the pandemic, so […]

item.title: Tesla Dojo: Elon Musk’s big plan to build an AI supercomputer, explained
item.description: Dojo is Tesla’s custom-built supercomputer that’s designed to train its “Full Self-Driving” neural networks. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What It Means to ‘Willie Horton’ a Political Candidate
item.description: Donald Trump supporters run their version of the original dog-whistle attack ad against Kamala Harris. Here’s the history.
